verses.kjv: And he said unto Moses, Come up unto the LORD, thou, and Aaron, Nadab, and Abihu, and seventy of the elders of Israel; and worship ye afar off.
verses.ct: God said to Moses, "Come up to the LORD â€” you, Aaron, Nadab, Abihu, and 70 of Israel's elders. Worship from a distance."

verses.kjv: And Moses alone shall come near the LORD: but they shall not come nigh; neither shall the people go up with him.
verses.ct: "Only Moses may approach the LORD directly. The others must not come near, and the rest of the people must not come up the mountain with him."

verses.kjv: And Moses came and told the people all the words of the LORD, and all the judgments: and all the people answered with one voice, and said, All the words which the LORD hath said will we do.
verses.ct: Moses went and reported everything the LORD had said to the people, including all his laws. The people responded together with one voice, "We will do everything the LORD has told us."

verses.kjv: And Moses wrote all the words of the LORD, and rose up early in the morning, and builded an altar under the hill, and twelve pillars, according to the twelve tribes of Israel.
verses.ct: Moses wrote down everything the LORD had said. He got up early the next morning and built an altar at the base of the mountain, along with 12 stone pillars representing the 12 tribes of Israel.

verses.kjv: And he sent young men of the children of Israel, which offered burnt offerings, and sacrificed peace offerings of oxen unto the LORD.
verses.ct: He sent young Israelite men to present burnt offerings and to sacrifice bulls as peace offerings to the LORD.

verses.kjv: And Moses took half of the blood, and put it in basons; and half of the blood he sprinkled on the altar.
verses.ct: Moses collected half of the blood and put it in bowls, and the other half he splashed against the altar.

verses.kjv: And he took the book of the covenant, and read in the audience of the people: and they said, All that the LORD hath said will we do, and be obedient.
verses.ct: Then he took the book of the covenant and read it out loud so all the people could hear. They responded, "We will do everything the LORD has said. We will obey."

verses.kjv: And Moses took the blood, and sprinkled it on the people, and said, Behold the blood of the covenant, which the LORD hath made with you concerning all these words.
verses.ct: Moses then took the blood and sprinkled it on the people, saying, "This is the blood of the covenant that the LORD has established with you based on all these instructions."

verses.kjv: Then went up Moses, and Aaron, Nadab, and Abihu, and seventy of the elders of Israel:
verses.ct: Then Moses, Aaron, Nadab, Abihu, and 70 of Israel's elders went up the mountain.

verses.kjv: And they saw the God of Israel: and there was under his feet as it were a paved work of a sapphire stone, and as it were the body of heaven in his clearness.
verses.ct: They saw the God of Israel. Beneath his feet was something like a pavement made of sapphire, as clear and brilliant as the heavens themselves.

verses.kjv: And upon the nobles of the children of Israel he laid not his hand: also they saw God, and did eat and drink.
verses.ct: God did not raise his hand against these leaders of Israel. They saw God, and they ate and drank in his presence.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Moses, Come up to me into the mount, and be there: and I will give thee tables of stone, and a law, and commandments which I have written; that thou mayest teach them.
verses.ct: The LORD said to Moses, "Come up to me on the mountain and stay there. I will give you stone tablets with the law and commandments I have written, so you can teach the people."

verses.kjv: And Moses rose up, and his minister Joshua: and Moses went up into the mount of God.
verses.ct: So Moses got up along with his assistant Joshua, and Moses went up the mountain of God.

verses.kjv: And he said unto the elders, Tarry ye here for us, until we come again unto you: and, behold, Aaron and Hur are with you: if any man have any matters to do, let him come unto them.
verses.ct: He told the elders, "Wait here for us until we come back. Look, Aaron and Hur are staying with you. Anyone who has a dispute should bring it to them."

verses.kjv: And Moses went up into the mount, and a cloud covered the mount.
verses.ct: Moses went up the mountain, and a cloud covered it.

verses.kjv: And the glory of the LORD abode upon mount Sinai, and the cloud covered it six days: and the seventh day he called unto Moses out of the midst of the cloud.
verses.ct: The glory of the LORD settled on Mount Sinai, and the cloud covered it for 6 days. On the 7th day, God called out to Moses from inside the cloud.

verses.kjv: And the sight of the glory of the LORD was like devouring fire on the top of the mount in the eyes of the children of Israel.
verses.ct: To the Israelites watching from below, the glory of the LORD looked like a consuming fire blazing on the mountaintop.

verses.kjv: And Moses went into the midst of the cloud, and gat him up into the mount: and Moses was in the mount forty days and forty nights.
verses.ct: Moses entered the cloud and went up the mountain. He stayed on the mountain for 40 days and 40 nights.
